name: Recovery Runs & Active Recovery
description: Gentle movement sessions designed to promote recovery without adding training stress. The hardest runs to do properly because they feel 'too easy'.

exercises.name: 20-Minute Recovery Jog
exercises.instructions: Run 20min at truly easy pace. Should feel EFFORTLESS. If in doubt, slow down more. This is about movement, not training.

modifications.harder: 25min at same very easy pace (NOT faster)

conditions.knee_moderate: Only if pain-free, otherwise substitute walk
conditions.any_moderate: Listen to body - recovery runs should never hurt

exercises.paceGuidance: This should be your slowest running pace. You could run at this pace while having a phone conversation. Many runners skip these or run them too hard.
exercises.purpose: Promotes blood flow for recovery without adding stress. Key to high mileage training.

exercises.name: Walk-Jog Recovery Mix
exercises.description: Alternating walking and very easy jogging
exercises.instructions: 20min total: alternate 2min easy jog, 1min walk. Repeat throughout. Focus on loosening up, not training.

conditions.any_moderate: Perfect for testing how injuries feel with minimal stress

exercises.paceGuidance: Jog portions should be barely faster than walking. This is movement therapy, not cardio training.

exercises.name: Morning Shake-Out Run
exercises.description: 10-15min easy run to wake up the body (great before race days)
exercises.instructions: 10-15min very easy running. No hills, no tempo, no goals. Just gentle movement to activate muscles and loosen up.

modifications.harder: 15min with a few 10s strides at the end (only if feeling good)

exercises.purpose: Used by elite runners on race morning or rest days. Wakes the body up, promotes blood flow, no fatigue added.
exercises.timing: Great for morning of race day, or day after hard workout

exercises.name: Deep Water Running
exercises.description: Zero-impact running in deep water with flotation vest
exercises.instructions: 20-30min running motion in deep water. Use flotation belt. Maintain upright posture, mimic running form. Can be easy or hard depending on effort.
exercises.benefits: Perfect for injury recovery - maintains fitness with zero impact. Also great for recovery between hard training blocks.
exercises.technique: Stay upright, don't lean forward. Mimic running motion. Focus on bringing knees up and pushing legs back.

exercises.name: 30-Minute Recovery Walk
exercises.instructions: Walk 30min at comfortable pace. No power walking, no hills. Just easy, enjoyable movement. Great for rest days.
exercises.benefits: Promotes recovery without any training stress. Aids digestion, mental health, sleep quality. Underrated by many runners.
exercises.mentalHealth: Great for thinking time, audiobooks, or social connection. Walking is not 'doing nothing' - it's active recovery.

exercises.name: Gentle Bike Spin
exercises.description: Easy cycling for active recovery (low impact)
exercises.instructions: 20-30min very easy cycling. Low resistance, high cadence (80-90 RPM). Should feel like you're spinning your legs out, not training.
exercises.benefits: Great for runner recovery - works muscles differently, zero impact. Promotes blood flow to legs.
exercises.technique: Keep resistance low. This should feel easy throughout. Focus on smooth pedaling, not power.
